text: <@U2H1YLSE6>  I'm not exactly sure what you are asking
<!channel>  Has anyone had an issue where the non www version of a domain with ssl will not redirect to the www. version with ssl?
yes !
<@U38EZFVFE> that's not usually a HubSpot issue and more of a server setting. In many cases (if apache) you need to check that http is not set
the server would need to have ssl that is setting up the redirect
we buy a SSL for the non-www to correct tuhis pb
if they already have ssl for the non www domain how would you set it up.
If you are using dns forwarding doesnt it bypass that?
Don’t know :disappointed:
I correct this issue buying SSL on non-www but if it is already done I don’t know
<@U38EZFVFE> just make sure that your redirects don't define the protocol. IE: (https/http) then it should work for both.
<@U38EZFVFE> I’ll help you out.  I believe the issue is that they’re currently redirecting backwards from what HS offers (they’re redirecting from www to root, rather than root to www).

Is it possible to submit a form through the forms API with frontend javascript? I thought it was, but this article suggests maybe no <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/do-HubSpot-apis-support-ajax-request>
The answer to this is the last update I’ve seen on that: <https://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/why-doesnt-the-form-api-require-a-key/2248/2>. Hoping that feature does get changed some time this year.
Boo
<@U5BGUA4BX> and anyoen else -- here is how you can make it work using js/jquery and ajax
<https://jsfiddle.net/5hjt4fxj/7/>
That is a fiddle I did.
here is the info i placed into the form
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F68JRS0BD/pasted_image_at_2017_07_13_06_11_pm.png|form input>
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F69GN1L1M/pasted_image_at_2017_07_13_06_12_pm.png|form notification in HubSpot>
by using ajax and posting data to the form URL
<https://forms.HubSpot.com/uploads/form/v2/{portalid}/{formid}>
you are sending a form post, just like any other post. no api needed. tried adding some other HubSpot variables to context -- you would want to pull those in to help you track your submissions

So I am trying to use Zapier to import a file to file manager. The only issue I am having is the `file_names` and other allowed fields are not working for renaming them or placing them in the right area.
Ran into that issue with file names that had spaces. Confirm that your file names don't have spaces because zapper doesnt show the error
they dont, im using underscores
im guessing its the unflatten option causing issues
<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F68QEFGJH/pasted_image_at_2017_07_13_05_50_pm.png|Pasted image at 2017-07-13, 5:50 PM>
do the allowed fields go into the data area or the header area?
